decision_conditions: SCHEDULE 1: CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY THE REGULATIONS
1.  The consent shall expire after 5 years from the date of this notice.

2.  Any advertisements displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
3.  Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition.
4.  Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
5.  No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

6.  No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters) or aerodrome (civil or military).
Note: These are imposed automatically unless expressly varied, for instance the time limit shortened. | SCHEDULE 2: CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY THE AUTHORITY

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the elevation drawings identified in supporting document "London Borough of Ealing Roadside Advertising Proposal Os 47 Haven Green W5 2NX - JCDecaux".
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the approved drawings, the illumination of the signs/advertisements shall comply with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Professionals in in their guidance document published 2015, PLG05 Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements.

Reason: To safeguard amenity and in the interests of public safety to accord with Paragraphs 136 and 199 of the NPPF (2021), Policies D3, D4, HC1, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18). | The advertisement shall change no more frequently than once every 10 seconds and shall not include any animation or exposed cathode tubing. The digital signs shall also not display any moving, or apparently moving, images (including animation, flashing, scrolling three dimensional, intermittent or video elements).

Reason: To safeguard amenity and in the interests of public safety to accord with Paragraphs 136 and 199 of the NPPF (2021), Policies D3, D4, HC1, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18).
| The screen shall be designed so that, in the event of breakdown, it shall automatically power-off to prevent flashing error messages being displayed, and it shall be so maintained.

Reason: To safeguard amenity and in the interests of public safety to accord with Paragraphs 136 and 199 of the NPPF (2021), Policies D3, D4, HC1, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18).
